edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPDoc

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPObject
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPDoc
public class LSPDoc
extends LSPObject

Represents the "doc" element as defined in the STARTS 1.0 specification. This encapsulates one document in a response to a query. It is generated on the back end and includes the following information:

  • Raw score of document. Not normalized. (double)
  • Size of document in KB(int)
  • Document count - the number of tokens in the document (int)
  • Sources where this document appears (LSPSource)
  • Field/value pairings that describe the document, for example "title, Neuromancer." (LSPField, String)
  • Term statistics. These are the terms used in the rankings of the query. Statistics include number of times the term apepars within document, term weight within document, and number of documents in the source that contain the term. (LSPTerm, double, double, int )
The back end developer typically instantiates one LSPDoc for each record in the response from the underlying collection, and then bundles all the doc objects into an LSPResults object.

There are getter methods for reading what is inside the doc object, but in general these are not used. They are cumbersome and use some public inner classes. This is because mostly, the framework reads this object using the standard toXML() method.

Parameters:

value - the value (example: Neuromancer)

removeFieldValue

public void removeFieldValue(LSPField field)
Remove a field/value pairing. This is sometimes needed in cases where an LSPDoc is created from some underlying collection before the "answer-fields" criterion can be applied. When that happens, the criterion is applied during post-processing, and sometimes field/value pairings have to be removed.
Parameters:
field - the field in the field/value pairing to be removed

addTermStat

public void addTermStat(LSPTerm term,
                        int termFreq,
                        double termWeight,
                        int docFreq)
Add a term statistic. Typically, these terms come from the ranking that was used in the query.
Parameters:
term - the term
termFreq - the number of times the term appears within the document
termWeight - the weight of the term within the document
docFreq - the number of documents in the source that have this term

setRawScore

public void setRawScore(double rawScore)
Set the un-normalized score of the document. This is the score that the original collection assigned to it.
Parameters:
rawScore - the score

setDocSize

public void setDocSize(int docSize)

docSize - the size
